Key Arguments: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right in a democracy and should not be restricted.
Censorship is a lazy approach to dealing with disagreement and can be dangerous.
The government's narrative during the COVID-19 pandemic was incorrect, and censorship of dissenting opinions cost lives.
Australia is obligated to uphold freedom of speech under international treaties, specifically the ICCPR.
There is a lack of confidence in the government's ability to provide accurate information.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a core right of every person in a democracy.
Censorship is lazy – censors are too lazy to debate or refute something they disagree with.
The government narrative was 180° wrong in every way during the covid episode.
